intro: Tetratheca nesogena, commonly known as the alpine tetratheca, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant is often found in rocky or sandy soils in alpine and subalpine regions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat. Tetratheca nesogena is an important component of the local flora and is often used in horticultural settings for its ornamental value.
